page.title: 15AN INTERVIEW
page.content: Mrs Longhurst has lived in the area all her life.She told us of the changes during the last 50 years.She told of the loss of many trees.Before the war much land was used for grazing,but now more is used for cereals.There used to be more children in the area than there are today. The buildings have changed little,the only new houses being built at the west end of Sherborne.There used to be five shops,but now there is only one. Shopping is inconvenient if you haven't a car.There are not so many buses as there used to be.During the war there were many evacuees.Sherborne house was used by British and American soldiers before D.Day.Mock battles were held near by. Mrs Longhurst likes living here because it is picturesque and quiet, but doesn't like the lack of transport.
